headline: Exclusive-ASML unveils EUV light source advance that could yield 50% more chips by 2030
summary: Researchers at ASML Holding say they have found a way to boost the power of the light source in a key chip making machine to turn out up to 50% more chips by decade's end, to help retain the Dutch company's ‌edge over emerging U.S. and Chinese rivals.  ASML is the world's only maker of commercial extreme ultraviolet lithography (EUV) machines, a critical tool for chipmakers such as ‌Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, Intel and others in producing advanced computing chips.  "It's not a parlor trick or something like this, where we demonstrate for a very short time that it can work," Michael Purvis, ASML's ​lead technologist for its EUV source light, said in an interview.

content.title: Exclusive-ASML unveils EUV light source advance that could yield 50% more chips by 2030
content.summary: Researchers at ASML Holding say they have found a way to boost the power of the light source in a key chip making machine to turn out up to 50% more chips by decade's end, to help retain the Dutch company's ‌edge over emerging U.S. and Chinese rivals.  ASML is the world's only maker of commercial extreme ultraviolet lithography (EUV) machines, a critical tool for chipmakers such as ‌Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, Intel and others in producing advanced computing chips.  "It's not a parlor trick or something like this, where we demonstrate for a very short time that it can work," Michael Purvis, ASML's ​lead technologist for its EUV source light, said in an interview.

thumbnail.caption: ASML reports Q4 earnings, in Veldhoven

headline: RAD Intel Formalizes Holding Company Structure to Power New AI-Driven Decision Layer for the $1T Ad Economy
summary: LOS ANGELES, February 23, 2026--RAD Intel, a leader in AI-driven marketing intelligence, today announced the formalization of a new holding company structure to support rapid expansion, future acquisitions, and the launch of two standalone operating businesses, RAD Amplify and Lickly. The move comes as global ad spend surpasses $1T annually, and industry estimates suggest roughly 40% of that spend is lost to inefficiency, primarily driven by decisions made too late in the planning cycle.

content.title: RAD Intel Formalizes Holding Company Structure to Power New AI-Driven Decision Layer for the $1T Ad Economy
content.summary: LOS ANGELES, February 23, 2026--RAD Intel, a leader in AI-driven marketing intelligence, today announced the formalization of a new holding company structure to support rapid expansion, future acquisitions, and the launch of two standalone operating businesses, RAD Amplify and Lickly. The move comes as global ad spend surpasses $1T annually, and industry estimates suggest roughly 40% of that spend is lost to inefficiency, primarily driven by decisions made too late in the planning cycle.
